description.narrative: Insatsen är en upphandling av en studie om möjligheten för Sida och Sverige att initiera forskningssamarbete med Somalia. Studien kommer att beskriva hur kapaciteten att bedriva forskning vid universiteten ser ut samt ge rekommendationer hur Sida/Sverige skulle kunna samarbete för att stödja forskningskapacitet i Somalia.

The contribution is a procurement of a feasibility study of research cooperation in Somalia. The study will provide a description of existing research capacity in Somalia and recommendations on if and how Sida could support research capacity building and research of high quality in Somalia.

The objective of the intervention was to procure a feasibility study of Research Cooperation in Somalia. The study was finalised in February 2020. The titel of the study is "Research in Somalia: opportunities for cooperation". The responsible consultancy firm was ODI and the authors are: Arnaldo Pellini, Deqa I. Abdi, Guled Salah, Hussein Yusuf Ali, Kalinaki Lawrence Quintin, Mohamed Abdi Hassan, Salim Said, Amina Khan and Ed Laws.

description.narrative: The study "Research in Somalia: opportunities for cooperation" is divided in five chapters. Chapter one is the introduction, chapter two summarises the literature review on the higher education system in fragile contexts. Chapter three describes the evolution of the higher education system in Somalia, its characteristics and governance, and international initiatives aimed at supporting university capacity strengthening and research cooperation. Chapter four synthesis the findings from interviews and workshops with key informants and chapter five sets out the conclusions and makes some suggestions to inform Sida's programming. There are eight main findings in the study. The findings concern the weak governance of the higher education system, which has resulted in a boom of private universities; limited federal and state financial resources for higher education systems; structural conditions hinder the production of good-quality research, for example very few or no staff in universities have research qualifications, academic publications do not lead to career progression etc.; security is a key limiting factor for the development of the higher education and research sector and a constraint on academic freedom; some, mainly private universities, have began to invest in research; Somali academics in the diaspora in Europe and East Africa represent an important resource for designing international research collaborations and improve quality in research training; the policy research institutes that have emerged over the last few years partly from donor-funded initiatives could be a resource in terms of mentoring and provide capacity development support to researchers in universities; there is an existing platform - Somali Research and Education Network - through which ways to strengthen research collaboration between members and with universities in the region and in Europe could be tested.
